Setting permissions to delete the object by the user
By default, users see those object instances and route objects (such as: applications for decision-making, transactions, collateral objects), in the context of which they are responsible/potentially responsible (see
Setting up a matrix for a business process
) and are able to delete them.
If this ability is unacceptable in the course of work, then this can be configured.
To prohibit deleting an instance of an object type, you need to:
1. Go to
Access to System objects
(by choosing in the menu consecutively: Administration â†’ Access to System objects).
2. Select the object type from the table which must not be deleted.
3. Specify whether it is allowed or restricted to be deleted.
4. Save the information by clicking
.
The ability to delete this instance is hidden.
